content: Jason, great write-up, and interesting comparisons to your previous ventures as well! I think that the game was profoundly rigged to make it possible for light-field (or any depth-sensing technology for that matter) to truly make a break in the Consumer Electronics business during the past couple of years. The combined disadvantages of poorer resolution, processing requirements / physical size and BOM costs just killed any business case any incumbent player would be able to support. If only Geoffrey Moore’s latest book on how to manage disruption would have been out a few years earlier… All the best for the pivot! Janne
